code: @Manual{,   title = {comunista: Fixes Names Of Chilean Municipalities For Easier Joining},   author = {Luis Herskovic},   year = {2022},   note = {R package version 0.0.1},   url = {https://github.com/lhersko/comunista}, }

what: Fixes Names Of Chilean Municipalities For Easier Joining
title: Fixes Names Of Chilean Municipalities For Easier Joining
text: goal comunista clean accents municipality names Chile gets proper format make joining datasets municipality easier.

title: Fixes Names Of Chilean Municipalities For Easier Joining
text: can install development version comunista GitHub : use pacman, can install using:

title: Fixes Names Of Chilean Municipalities For Easier Joining
text: use clean_comunas() function first specify data frame name variable contains municipality names quotations. example: use code_comunas() function first specify data frame name variable contains municipality names quotations. example: strongly suggested run clean_comunas() data running code_comunas().
code: library(comunista) df <- data.frame(comunas=c("ñuñoa", "Peñalolén", "PEñaflor", "Las condes")) clean_comunas(df, "comunas") #>      comunas #> 1      Nunoa #> 2  Penalolen #> 3   Penaflor #> 4 Las Condes library(comunista) df <- data.frame(comunas=c("ñuñoa", "Peñalolén", "PEñaflor", "Las condes")) df_clean <- clean_comunas(df, "comunas") code_comunas(df_clean, "comunas") #>      comunas cod_comuna #> 1 Las Condes      13114 #> 2      Nunoa      13120 #> 3   Penaflor      13605 #> 4  Penalolen      13122

what:
Fix accents and weird characters in municipalities and gets them in proper format.
Also converts some municipality names that can be spelled differently to a standard format. — clean_comunas
title:

what: This function matches municipalities by name to their corresponding INE code — code_comunas

title: This function matches municipalities by name to their corresponding INE code — code_comunas
This function matches municipalities by name to their corresponding INE code — code_comunas
code: df <- data.frame(comunas=c("ñuñoa", "Peñalolén", "PEñaflor", "Las condes")) clean_df <- clean_comunas(df, "comunas") code_comunas(clean_df, "comunas") #>      comunas cod_comuna #> 1 Las Condes      13114 #> 2      Nunoa      13120 #> 3   Penaflor      13605 #> 4  Penalolen      13122
